description.p: This event fires after the user has updated a record.

page.discussion: If the user updates multiple records at once, this event will be called multiple times - once for each record that was updated. Contrast with the [AfterUpdateRecords] event.

section.description: The following variables are available to you in the event:

item.name: e.rtc
item.description: You can put any data in this variable that you want to pass to other events. e.g. *[xb:e.rtc.mydata = 'value1']*

item.name: e.rtc.A_AjaxResponses
item.description: A pointer to the AjaxResponses array.

item.name: e.oldDataSubmitted
item.description: Field values, before any user edits

item.name: e.DirtyFields
item.description: CRLF delimited list of fields that were edited

section.title: Returning JavaScript
section.description: Your can return JavaScript to execute in the browser by setting the *[xb:aa]* array:
section.example: dim aa as p aa = e.rtc.A_AjaxResponses aa[].text = "alert('Message');" aa[..].id = 100 'the order in which the Ajax responses are sent to the browser

description.p: You can also set state variables in this event. The value of any state variables will be available in all subsequent ajax callbacks (in the e.__si2 object).
